Reviews.Title: “A Palace in central Venice...”
Reviews.Author: NunoVaz
Reviews.Content: Our 3-night stay at the Bauer Il Pallazo was almost excellent. First of all, the location is perfect, right in front of the Grand Canal, and at a 5-minute walk to San Marco Square, this is the perfect location to explore Venice, mainly if it is a first time. The room, a deluxe suite, was very nice with as "Ã©poque" decoration, spacious and confortable, although a little bit oldie. The breakfast, on the roof terrace (this is the tallest building in Venice), was excellent. The service was average (for a plus 500 euro/night hotel) and the restaurant (De Pisis) was a disappointment. The overall experience of staying at a Palace in central Venice was fully achieved, but there is room for improvements

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: AggieOrtho
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my final stop on a trip through Italy. Definitely saved the best for last. This is the place to splurge on your hotel. I highly recommend this hotel...worth every penny. The staff was friendly and helpful and not snobby or pretentious. They upgraded our room upon arrival at no charge. We had a junior suite with a view of a side canal and partial view of the grand canal...amazing! The breakfast is incredible...a huge variety and what a beautiful setting...eating on the roof-top, open-air lounge with 360 degree view of the city. They arranged a free tour (and transportation) to Murano for a glass-blowing demonstration. Cannot say enough great things about this place. We had no problems and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Holiday”
Reviews.Author: antonioburla
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this wonderful hotel for a three nights and four days holiday. When expressed my dissatisfaction with the room, I was referred to Massimo who immediately changed my room to a fantastic value alternative. The new room was about 50 sqm in size, fantastic tall ceiling, and everything about it was spacious and grand. Facilities (particularly Gym) were excellent in comparison to other grand lux hotels in Venice and breakfast was just superb and served on a beautiful terrace overlooking the canale grande.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY!!! A+”
Reviews.Author: davidojs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after spontaneously deciding to stay the night in Venice while visiting on vacation with my father. I was amazed at how accommodating the staff was for a walk-in reservation. Not only did the helpful gentleman at the desk "Massimo" take the time to show us different rooms (We were unsure if the rooms were worth the price), but they let us pick the one we wanted at the end. The room we chose was amazing. The walls were lined with elegant fabric, and the view was to die for. Overall, it was very ritzy. To top it all off, the breakfast spread in the morning was great, and they had both Italian and American cuisine. I must say, I will be back on my next Venetian visit in April!

Reviews.Title: “My Christmas Present”
Reviews.Author: fromtex
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Old World 2 Room Suite with Balcony on the Grand Canal. Classic Modern Bathroom with separate shower and spa tub which felt great after a day of exploring. Authentic Art which gave the Living Room a Rich Quality. Breakfast in Settimo Cielo was heavenly (view on the Grand Canal, Food, Drink & Service included) Passing gondola's added to the ambiance. Staff - Good to Us! Oh the Memories :)

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town”
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: Our visit was a birthday treat and the Bauer lived up to expectations. The concierge was brilliant, assisting us with tickets to concerts and generally pointing us in the right direction each day. Our room was lovely and the setting for breakfast on the sun drenched terrace overlooking the grand canal was sublime. Best of all though is the combination of setting and location - so close to everything are combined. Loved all the 30s furniture and fittings too.

Reviews.Title: “This boutique hotel in Venice has it all!”
Reviews.Author: Texastraveler065
Reviews.Content: The Bauer Il Palazzo met and even exceeded my expectations. While not inexpensive, this lovely hotel is well worth the money. The location is excellent, just a short walk from Piazza San Marco. My room had a great view of the Grand Canal and was beautifully appointed. As a solo female traveller, I really appreciated the attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a Ritz Carlton like experience in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Charlieojs
Reviews.Content: .ocation, location, location. This hotel is right in the middle of everything. Best access to everything Venice. Rooms are gorgeous. Staff is unbelievably helpful and friendly. Yes, it is a bit pricey, but YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR! This property is every bit on par with the best Ritz Carlton's in the US. Make sure you have a drink at on of their bars. Concierge can plan your whole day for you.

Reviews.Title: “a very beautifu hotel”
Reviews.Author: diane119
Reviews.Content: from the moment we arrived brought by the private boat belonging to the hotel to the moment we left we fould everything about this hotel to be delightful. we arrive late in teh afternoon after flying from the united states were greeted by the manager and led a beautiful room with a large terrace overlooking Venice with a side view of the lagoon. the room as absolutely beautiful with walls covered in blue silk. the soaps and lotions in the bath were exceptional.. the room was serviced beautifully with great attention to detail.. the restaurant had delicious food. all in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to vencie

Reviews.Title: “Good location but ...”
Reviews.Author: NanaH630
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel, but enormous public spaces of the Bauer itself are off-putting. The view from the 7th floor breakfast room is however spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Scooterp1e
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the hotel and we appreciate the location and privacy.The 7th floor breakfast room offers excellent buffet and terrific views of the Canal.. The room was spacious but the rugs should be replaced and the housekeeping department could do a better job. All in all a good place to stay, but could use a good cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dale K
Reviews.Content: The hotel personal is very professional and helpful. I didn't like the Entrance to the lobby or coming down an alley to enter the lobby. Our room Was nice but much too dark, the lighting was terrible. The bathroom was excellent . But not good enough to stay there again. The dining room was very good and so was the food.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate hotel in the greatest city”
Reviews.Author: PharmaTraveller
Reviews.Content: If you want a great hotel in Venice, one that will cater to your every need, is easily accessible by both boat and land, is a hop, skip and a jump away from St. Marks Square, the Bauer Il Palazzo is it!!!!! Just wonderful! The ambience of a Venetian palace with all the comfort a hotel can offer. The Bauers have two adjacent properties and while the Hotel Bauer is a beautiful hotel, the Il Palazzo is simply majestic and I suggest choosing it. I was in suite 352 and could not get over the lush and luxury surroundings with a great view. True, you need to understand the internal architecture so not to get lost but this only takes a short while. The staff was amazing, from the concierge to the reception - thank you Massimo and others - to the restaurant, breakfast room (amazing on the 7th floor) and room staff. If Venice is the best place to visit, the Bauer il Palazzo is the place to do it from. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise in Venice !”
Reviews.Author: Jens S
Reviews.Content: Tooo much thinking is not so good and i THOUGHT that Venice would be a one time in life experience and was SURPRISED by its beauty and history and many many nice places, restaurants and awesome buildings. The Il Pallazzo in Venice was from A to Z a very warm place where you feel yourself at home and the architecture and interior design is magnificient and worse seeing - i will go back to visit this wonderful hotel and one of the most charming cities in this world

Reviews.Title: “Ahh Venice!”
Reviews.Author: cadeaugratuit
Reviews.Content: There's certainly no place like Venice! For a first time visitor, the Bauer Palazzo staff can make all the difference for a seamless experience. As it is unique, arrival in Venice can be tricky to negotiate. One doesn't just drive up to the Hotel Check In! The CONCIERGES at the Bauer all speak good English. We called the hotel for our reservations. As we were returning guests, we remembered our first experience driving into Venice. The confusing arrival can be eliminated with the help of the Concierge. They made the reservation for PARKING OUR CAR, as one gets off the Autostrada. A PORTER met us at the PARKING GARAGE and took our bags, for the not too short walk to the WATER TAXI STATION. Alternately, one can struggle to find parking in this very congested area, and just pray! There are also PUBLIC water taxis, if you feel you can schlep all your bags and load them on and off the crowded vapoetto. Fine if you travel light and don't mind the walk. The Bauer Palazzo is ON the Grand Canal. Location of your hotel makes a huge difference in Venice. It's a common sight to see tourists STRUGGLING with their bags over the cobblestones and many bridges, trying to get to their hotels in the city's interior. A porter to meet you is highly recommended. NO WORRY for this at the Bauer Palazzo!! I always feel like a princess when I arrive by the private water taxi to the hotels PRIVATE water taxi entrance! We prefer the Palazzo over the more modern Bauer, its sister hotel. The Palazzo is old Venetian splendor, with the most beautiful marble bathrooms you have ever seen. Rarely am I impressed with hotel bath amenities, but I love theirs so much I always buy some as gifts! The face and body cremes are locally made, the result of the Hotel's glamorous owner starting a program to help incarcerated women. Under the training of scientists, they create the most luxurious natural cremes! Always a big hit with friends and a wonderful contribution to the community. Our last stay was in a JR Suite, with a partial view of the Grand canal. The most beautiful view of all is for BREAKFAST, served at the HOTEL's ROOF RESTAURANT. The view will take your breath away, looking over all of Venice. The breakfast (included) menu is varied enough to not be boring over several days. We learned you can also get eggs, omelettes, etc to order. Typically we enjoy roof top breakfasts on the exterior patio, but this trip we were plagued with wasps! I wondered why there were no wasp traps in place as the insects were attracted to the fantastic fruit salad and pastry. The servers are very congenial and the cafe macchiato the best! For a great experience, tell the concierges that you want to have dinner where the locals eat-we enjoyed different neighborhoods, great food and of course, lower prices. Don't forget to have a Vino or a Choccolata on St Mark's Square while listening to the evening music under the stars-the Bauer Palazzo is perfectly located in the center of Venice. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Different View of Venice from the 7th Floor”
Reviews.Author: Cathyc7
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 7th floor and looked out over the roofs of Venice to the Grand Canal. The views are spectacular and unexpected. We loved the beautiful fabrics on the walls and the large, luxurious bathrooms. We ate quite good buffet breakfast on the 7th floor patio, complete with a seagull watching us. We had lunch twice at De Pisis, once outside and once inside. The food was excellent. The staff was very helpful with restaurant suggestions and reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous!”
Reviews.Author: JonathanWalkerJersey
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Palazzo is just the first part of the very best of Venetian experience: you can either arrive by boat from the fabulous (just for once the word is justified) Grand Canal or by land down a tiny dark back alley - in Venice the street entrance was always the back door - but what a discreet way to arrive at this most sumptuous hotel in a City that almost invented the idea of "sumptuous". If you are staying in the best, that's enough: you do not need everyone else to know! The foyer itself is small and like a jewel-box in deep,venetian colours, rich with silk and old chinese lacquer. The chinese flavour seems odd until you remember that Marco Polo was Venetian... We had a suite with a view of the Salute church that almost took your breath away and was as sumptuous (that word again but it's inescapable in connection with the Palazzo) with silk damask on the walls, glass chandeliers, more gilt and huge rococo mirrors to make the best of the light for which Venice is famous. On the bed was fresh linen everyday - not cotton, proper crisp, cool linen which is better even that the highest thread count cotton. After that, it was a treat every morning to press the button by the bed and have the blinds rise to give you a view that could fairly be the best in the world. As a guest of the Palazzo you have the huge benefit of breakfast on the roof terrace where the ladies are, as others have mentioned, superb - they have personality and character but with superb professionalism which starts off the day just right and then of course there's the view - again, the first time that you see it (I would say each day) it takes your breath away, but the same is also true on the terrace of the de Pisis restaurant on the canal and the side terrace for rinks too. I've stayed in several other of the famous Venetian hotels and I don't recall any of them having quite such an astonishing outlook. The food also lives up to the view, which is not something that you can take for granted, at all. All of this means that the experience of staying at the Palazzo is about as good as it gets in Venice but even that would not be enough if the staff did not live up to it: they do. There is a depth to the polish that exceeds even the highest expectations because they are not only superbly professional, they are also human - the service is carried out with a comfortable ease that, without any fanfare, makes everything right before you even knew what you wanted, even at the smallest level of summoning a lift. I must also mention the concierge team - they set standards of helpfulness and anticipating the questions that you would ask if you know what you wanted to know, which spoils you for anywhere else. And as for Paolo di Vacri, the Head Concierge, on his own he could have justified the reputation that Concierges have for being able to organise anything at all - he could and did and from achieving the impossible with which I was already delighted, within a couple of hours, he had improved even on that. You might had guessed that I and my partner had a wonderful time here. The only problem is that it might make everywhere seem just a little second-rate

Reviews.Title: “Simply not good enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: BigBlue1894
Reviews.Content: First of all the Palazzo is simply the boutique part of the actual Bauer hotel and it would seem that the differences between the two are minimal. From what I could gather they were: The Bauer had an impressive reception area compared with the Palazzo's rather pokey little room. The Bauer is accessed via a main square whereas the Palazzo is accessed by a narrow alleyway full of cooking smells. The Bauer doesn't have any rooms with Grande Canal views whereas the Palazzo's rooms generally do.Â  The Bauer guests take their breakfast at the canal side in the De Pisis restaurant whereas the Palazzo guests take theirs on a roof terrace.Â  The route from reception to the room at the Palazzo is tortuous in the extreme and you have to go via reception because the room keys are so large you wouldn't want to carry them around with you. What's wrong with key cards guys? The Bauer is cheaper.Â  At E 1,500 per night minimum for a Grande Canal suite you'd expect something pretty good and the Il Palazzo is very good. No point in me going on about all the great things - they are a given at these prices but what about the downsides? The first thing that hits you when you alight your water taxi is the huge uPVC front door. Hmmmm. Someone needs shooting for that I'd say! The checkin process wasn't the best. We were asked to wait in a room off the rather small dark reception area for what we thought was going to be 5 minutes. Â We got talking to a lovely South African couple who told us that they'd already waited 2 hours. I went to see the receptionist who confirmed that the room wasn't going to be ready for another 2/3 hours. What the heck did they expect us to do? Stare into the blank wall for 3 hours with our South African buddies?Â  We went for a nice lunch instead but this should just not happen in any establishment never mind one so expensive. First impressions count guys! We had a lovely suite with a view of the Grande Canal. We stayed for 7 nights and I would seriously question the value of the view for such a long stay. After 3 nights we'd taken it for granted! The suite was a little tired. There was an old fashioned TV in the lounge (how ridiculously cheap are LCD TVs these days?) and the LCD in the bedroom had a poor picture. The Satellite channels were the usual BBC World / CNN rubbish and there were no movies or pay TV. E 1,500 a night guys. Come on, you can really do better than this. The word Cheap springs to mind.Â  Sticking with the cheap theme the safe had a KEY! What's wrong with changing them up for a combination? Being tight and cheap again methinks.Â  The closets are a bit dark, there are no bedside cabinets, only tables and the mini bar didn't have any still wine. I seriously think the owner needs to stay in each room and see what's missing in practice and then spend some cash on sorting it out.Â  Really good points? The breakfast ladies are superb and the breakfast itself is very good. The WIFI is either free or very cheap depending upon how lucky you are.Â  Would I come back? I don't think I'd pay a premium to stay at Il Palazzo but I may well stay at the Bauer Il Pallido across the water.Â

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: HotelFanDeluxeYes
Reviews.Content: Our stay was absolute perfection. Location, views, cuisine, comfortable chic interiors, fantastic concierge staff, welcoming involved managers and more. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in venice”
Reviews.Author: Lilyrose30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the start of our honeymoon in April 2011, and asked for a quiet room with a view of the Grand Canal - a tall order given the hectic nature of the Grand Canal, but they managed to fulfill! As we had advised in advance that this was our honeymoon, the manager kindly upgraded us to a suite, with a lounge area, large bedroom, impressive marble bathroom, walk in wardrobe and little balcony overlooking the Grand Canal - so lovely to wake each morning to the sound of the gondaliers singing! The hotel is made up of several buildings, and so finding your room can seem like a bit of a challenge, but take the time to enjoy the architechture and the old and new interiors and it becomes an adventure. The rooms are seriously impressive - silk wallpaper and wonderfully comfortable beds, you'd be forgiven for thinking you'd arrived a weary traveller and woken the next morning as part of a wealthy family in Titan times. If Venice is sinking, it may be because of the enormous amounts of marble used in the bathrooms! A spacious room with large bath and seperate equally large shower, 2 sinks and a selection of handmade local toiletries. Breakfast is also excellent - a good selection of hot and cold choices at a regulary replenished buffet, with waitress service for coffee. The terrace can be windy, and the pidgeons quite bold if you leave your plate, but it's well worth it for the panoramic view across the canal and the city. Tips & places to go: The hotel concierge, while very helpful, seem to be very fond of the top-price restaurants. Venice is very expensive to eat out anyway (â‚¬25 for a coffe in Piazza San Marco, I kid you not), but more often you can walk away from the main tourist areas and find an excellent meal for a much more reasonable price. Look for places that are busy, then check the menu outside for prices. Take a good guide book (we used Lonley Planet and EyeWitness) and you'll find plenty of good places in the many hidden streets. Rosa Rosso is excellent for Venetian pizza! Get up early and head for the Rialto food market - an impressive display of fruit and veg, and a large fish market. You really need to get there early to see it as shopkeepers will have bough everything by 8am, but it's worth the early rise, and there's always plenty of cafes for a quick espresso to keep you going. Everywhere in Venice is crowded, so an early rise to see the sights at their least populated is a must, as is a walking tour - you'll see places you'd never have found. If you're looking for a massage, make sure you go to the sister location, not the one attached to the gym on the top floor of the hotel - it's expensive and my masseur was obviously also the gym manager, so stopped twice to answer the phone and a knock at the door during my massage - not very relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Not anywhere close to expectation”
Reviews.Author: MTCinTN
Reviews.Content: We were visiting friends in Venice and this hotel was highly recommended by Trip Advisor and other usually credible sources. We paid over 1,000 USD per night and did not mind the costs but we were incredibly disappointed. The film festival was in town, so if you weren't Sophia Loren or George Clooney, well you weren't anybody at Il Pallazzo. The ladies at the 7th floor veranda breakfast were a breath of fresh air, as their attitudes and service were excellent. However, the reception desk was aloof and seemed bothered to help, and everything...EVERYTHING...was extra. Example, if you'd like to use the hot tub jacuzzi on the roof, try 140 USD for 50 minutes. We went up to the veranda to gaze at Venice at night-(see the "view from our room") and were shooed away by the resident manager-Jonathan-as we were not permitted to use the veranda at night. Really??? As guests of the hotel we should have been welcomed to use the facilities. Our room was lovely, really, nicely decorated and laid out. We had water dripping from above our closet getting our clothes and shoes wet...called the desk and reported the problem...placed a waste basket under the drip...never heard from anyone on the issue...hmmm. An annual regatta/parade was being held on Sunday 9/4 and we thought we'd enjoy sitting out at the restaurant with our guests from the city for a while to take in the festivities...only way to get that done was to book a six course meal for over 400USD per person-BEVERAGES EXCLUDED!! Needless to say, we spent all our time out of the hotel as we felt unwelcome and treated like tourists rather than guests. When we checked out- no one even asked about our stay. I guessed they didn't want to know. We've enjoyed a number of 5 star properties/experiences....This is not one. No way would we ever stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in Venice”
Reviews.Author: judygCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This was my third time at the Il Palazzo, I was with my 19 year old Grandaughter. We were on a cruise ship and I saw it was overnighting in Venice. Even though it would have saved quite a bit of money to stay on the ship, I could not resist the chance to show her sheer Luxury. Of course the Bauer Il Palazzo did not disappoint. The service, the private check in, the bedding, everything was incredible (once again).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: Sergio_SM
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop of our honeymoon in Italy (we were arriving from Paris). We arrived by water taxi, which was great. The friendly staff promptly took our bags to the room, while we waited in the lobby enjoying a nice coffeee. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable, although the first one had a problem in the bedroom's window. We only noticed that a cold breeze was entering the room when we went to sleep. The staff promptly checked the window (at my request), and since they would not be able to repair it at that time, they moved us to another room (a little bit smaller, but more modern). Mr. Paolo (the manager) and his staff we very sorry for the inconveninent, and offered us complimentary drinks in the bar. We believed they dealt very well with the situation. The location is superb, very close to St. Mark's Square, and the breakfast was one of the best we had in the entiry honeymoon. The view from the 7th floor is memorable, and got even better because it snowed in our last day (we were leaving right after breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ColinandDidier
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really fantastic, the rooms are sumptuous without being stuffy. Stunning location just of the Grand Canal. We had breakfast on the terrace every morning just amazing. Will be back to Venice again but will try somewhere else but if its a first time visit I would recommend this Hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location but experience both good and bad”
Reviews.Author: mag1calspider
Reviews.Content: Arrival by water taxi was wonderful! and being ushered into the quaint lobby was great. We had booked a deluxe room with a view. We were taken to room 103 on the first floor. The room was very elegant, but the view was only really available if you had your head out of the window!! Shortly after arrival water started pouring through the ceiling of our bathroom. (looking at the ceiling this was not the first time) and the management moved us to (?upgraded?) a room on the 8th floor. The room was not as "grand" with low ceilings, but we did have views of the roof tops of Venice which was lovely. Breakfast was served on a terrace on the 7th floor which was fantastic, with amazing views. We had dinner one evening in the hotel restaurant, outside right on the Grand Hotel. The location was fantastic, and the service and quality of the food very good, but at a cost! It was a very enjoyable evening. The service that most disapointed us was the arrangement of a water taxi to our cruise ship. The taxi fare was 90 euros, but in the lobby, unbeknown to us there was another couple also waiting for a taxi to the same ship. The concierge did not even ask if we wanted to share (which we both would have happily done) - We feel this was pure greed on the part of the conceirge. This unfortunately put a taint on our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but great experience”
Reviews.Author: marieny524
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Bauer. We were only in Venice for 2 nights so being near the crowded St. Mark's square didn't bother us because it made it easier to access the main sights. I probably liked the "old world charm" of this hotel more than my husband, who would've preferred to more modern part of the Bauer hotel that the Palazzo is attached to, but like any hotel, it is all about what you personally prefer. The hotel itself felt very luxurious to us. We were given a beautiful suite with 2 marble bathrooms and because it was our honeymoon, a bottle of Prosecco upon our arrival. We enjoyed having such spacious accommodations even though we didn't have a Canal view. We loved having breakfast on the roof terrace every morning - the food, view and staff were fantastic. In terms of customer service the front desk was a bit stiff, but they were certainly helpful, including making reservations for us for dinner, taxis, etc. I really enjoyed the Bauer Il Palazzo because like Venice itself, it afforded us a look at a completely different world than what we were used to in New York City. If you have the funds, the Bauer is worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: WrldtrvlrBH
Reviews.Content: The Bauer Palazzo looks beautiful on their sketchy website. It seems to be ideally situated on the Grand Canal near St Mark's Square. BUT: 1) the location is hectic and noisy, swarmed by cruise ship day-trippers and tour groups 2) the rooms are old and dilapidated 3) the staff, particualrly the front desk and concierges, tend to be haughty, arrogant types who ignore the concept of customer service 4) we were promised a suite with a courtyward view. It ended up opening onto a noisy, dark narrow alley with no courtyard at all. 5) the place is super expensive, very poor value for what you get 6) bedding was stiff and old. Beds were arguable the worst I have ever slept in, at least in the "luxury" category The only positive memories are of the breakfasts from the rooftop restaurant, where the staff were most helpful and the views exceptional. Also, the resident managers were courteous when we raised our concerns, although no effective solution could be found given how booked the hotels were. But, no compensation was offered in terms of rate reduction or any other concessions that might have eased the pain.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and would return”
Reviews.Author: Olliesfriend
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, we were upgraded to a room with a fantastic view. The staff was gracious and helpful. My only complaint is that it is very confusing finding your way around the hotel. It is quite large, and to make things more confusing it is linked to the sister hotel (which seems more modern). There are no signs that I noticed to help you find your way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Helioda-san
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and loved every minute. Breakfast on the 7th floor terrace is a treat. Rooms were spacious (junior Suite) and beds were great. Clean and comfortable - makes you want to stay in your room a bit longer. Very friendly and helpful Service. Excellent location for every Kind of activity in Venice. Looking forward to our Next stay hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and you really feel like in a palace!”
Reviews.Author: Toret8
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights there last May. The service wasn't outstanding, but good. The only flaw I found was that they had only one computer with a printer that wasn't working and the staff wasn't very helpful. It took me more than one hour to finally get my boarding pass printed. Unacceptable for a hotel of this level. The location is excellent and the breakfast on the terrace of the hotel was like being in a movie...except for the bread.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover23456
Reviews.Content: After consideration of Danieli, Gritti, Cipriani and the Bauer options, we opted for Bauer Il Palazzo, mostly because so many recent reviewers found the rooms in Danieli and Gritti in need of refurbishing, because Cipriani is on the "wrong" side of the Grand Canal, and because Il Palazzo appears to be the best of the Bauer options ... and we are very pleased with our choice. Our beautiful 2-room suite was spacious and luxuriously appointed, with a mini-balcony facing the Grand Canal. The staff was warm and welcoming to us (a gay couple), the hotel is beautiful and Il Palazzo possesses what is arguably the perfect location in all of Venice. Breakfasts on the 7th floor terrace offer sensational views of the entire island city, and the waterside restaurant offers fine dining at the mouth of the Grand Canal. We did receive shockingly bad service at the spa (which is located at another Bauer property right across the Canal), and we'd recommend against using it, but that issue was mostly offset by the fact that the general manager of the Venice Bauers called me a few days later in Rome to apologize and provide an accommodation on the spa charge. One other quibble is that the front desk personnel could do a better job processing guests ... check in was slow for a hotel of this caliber, and too often we found a pile-up of folks in the lobby, leading us to forego making a request. But that aside, this is a 5-star hotel that provided us with a memorable first-class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid During the Venice Biannale”
Reviews.Author: Oldtimer55555
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights last week, whem the place was overrun with the art world. Parties went on nightly outside our room until 0300 hrs. And the concierge and restaurant staff were quite rude at times...until one tamed them with large tips to give some service. We have stayed here before a couple of times and always swore that we wouldnt return, but come the opening of the huge art exhibition one doesn't have much choice in Venice. Also how can a five star hotel not offer high speed internet in the rooms?

Reviews.Title: “Grand Location”
Reviews.Author: Beaumarisgirl_10
Reviews.Content: We arrived in style at the Bauer Il Palazzo on 7th April 2011. We caught a private water taxi from the airport which took about 40 minutes and cost 100 euro. When we arrived at the hotel we were greated by Paulo and his team, they took our luggage off the boat and straight up to our room, whilst we were offered a glass of water and somewhere to rest whilst they organised the room key for us. The room (746) was on the 7th floor and had a lovely large terrace which views over the Grand Canal and the busy street behind the hotel with all the lovely designer shops on. The room it self was a little tired but I think Venetian style in general is! The bathroom was lovely, all marble with a seperate shower and bath and nice big mirrors, essential for a lady!! My only fault about this hotel is some of the staff just did not seem to care. On the day we arrived I wanted to have a glass of Prosecco sitting next to the Grand Canal. We sat and waited to be served, only after my boyfriend asked 3 times could someone take our order did we eventaully get a drink. The De Pisis restaurant is also extremely expensive and neither I or my bf enjoyed our meals. I actaully could not eat mine it was so bad. When the waiter came to take my plate away (still full) he did not ask why I hadn't eaten my meal. They did however, not charge for any of our drinks, so maybe this was the reason. The concierge and all the team on reception including Paulo could not do enough for you and if you are going to stay in Venice for the first time as pricey as the Palazzo is I think it's a must to stay here or Gritti Palace or Westin Regina. I didn't like the look of the Danieli or any of the other hotels further on from St Marks Square (far too busy an area to stay in). Our hotel room was lovely and quiet if a bit of a treck to get to. The hotel is split into 2 defenately different bits. The Baher urban, is very chic and Art Deco and the Il Palazzo is old and true Venetian style. We went to the Cipriani Hotel for lunch over on Guidecca Island, what an amazing hotel and an amazing spot.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: MichiganJim2009
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. There is no better location. This hotel is bit confusing. Their is actually 2 hotels attached. The Bauer is newer and more modern. The Il Palazzo is being renovated, but some of the rooms are very old and need some updating. The staff is very nice and knowledagable. The longer you stay the more it grows on you. Just be very specific about your room catagory and room type and confirm what the view is going to be. It is typical Venitian, but be sure to ask questions. The staff does try very hard to accomodate,

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: vickikc
Reviews.Content: I have been to Venice several times--staying at the Bauer Il Palazzo was spectacular. From the impecable service to the beautiful rooftop terrace, this stay was a dream.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Cristab
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and in a wonderful location! The only negative thing I can say is the bed comfort needs to be improved. Otherwise this was a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “How to feel like royalty in your own palace in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: KiwigirlNZ
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here because the 6 star hotel I tried to get a 2nd night in was full for Venice FIlm Festival! Another guest had written don't stay here try Palazzo it's nicer and you'll be treated like someone special even if you aren't! They were so right! From the moment we got out of the water taxi we were treated superbly by the wonderfully trained staff, our room was the best ever in any hotel, bathroom and toiletries probably best ever; the surroundings were gorgeous -magnificent chandaliers, beautiful antiques. Being able to have a drink on the main canal and breakfast overlooking all the scenic highlights -what more could you want. Highly recommended. Forgot to mention fantastic location - handy to all the must see's and do's.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: isabelavv
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal, the staff is so amiable and attentive. Rooms were beautiful. Lunch at the terrace overlooking the canal was great (recommend the parma ham and mozarella toasted sandwich for a light lunch). It is expensive but worth it

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful experience.....”
Reviews.Author: pmdubai
Reviews.Content: Perhaps my expectations of hotels have been pushed too high through my extensive travels across the Middle East where service and room/property stardards have excelled in recent years. I find I have to adjust those expectations when travelling in Europe and prepare myself for the indifference of the conceirge, with hand held out, and aloof receptionist applying discretionary charges as a matter of course. The Bauer Il Palazzo is a complete exception and a perfect delight to find. From collection on the platform at Venice's train station to drop off at the airport, the experience was first class and arguably the best value for money from any of our hotels on this trip. Yes, its quirkily fitted into an 18th Century building - not unusual for Venice.. and yes, there's a price attached to quality and location - but it had both in abundance. The concierge could not be more welcoming, their advice more apprieciated and their approach to our 11 yr old son and 78 yr old mother could not have been any more considerate. 10 out of 10 for the staff culture that exists within this property. This 3 night stay in Venice rounded off our short tour of Italy and was a perfect way to end it. Thank you to Christina and the family that manage this property so well..... The Bauer Il Palazo will be our temporary home in Venice from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: LT789
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Italy where we spent several nights at Il Palazzo. The hotel has an elegant charm (very different from the adjoining Bauer, which is much more modern). The staff were terrific -- very helpful. We loved the breakfast on the rooftop terrace -- it was the perfect way to start a day in Venice. Having said that, breakfast was included with our room (at 400 euros per night); I would not have paid 50 euros per person for the breakfast. The location (close to St. Mark's Square) is very good. I would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay in the heart of venice”
Reviews.Author: shesim
Reviews.Content: the service was faultless from the moment we arrived till our departure. the rooms, a bit dated, but lovely and large for italian standards ! breakfast was outstanding in a superb room overlooking the canal. you cannot ask for a better location in venice and i would strongly recommend the bauer to others ..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlaundenTrees
Reviews.Content: We satyed at the Bauer il Palazzo for 5 nights it was just perfect a very unasuming 5 star hotel, very well positioned If you want marble, gold,and glitz stay next door at the sister hotel. Breakfast is on the top floor fatastic views cant fault it The concierge Paolo is a gem booked retaurats concerts made sure we were trated well everwhere he booked is a tabel. The view we had from our room was the best good size and the bathroom large and very well equiped, separtae shower. Expensive but worth it

Reviews.Title: “Great rooftop terrace, but thumbs down because of its front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: topaccommodations
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights after arriving from an overnight flight from the US. The hotel is a hotel within a hotel (The Bauer), making it private. We booked a grand canal suite - one of the more expensive rooms in the hotel. We had a nice (but not spectacular) water view, and a very small balcony that one could barely step out onto. The room was very quiet, despite the noise of the grand canal below. However, of all the rooms we stayed at in Italy in this particular price range, this was the smallest. The best thing about this hotel is the rooftop terrace where they serve breakfast. And breakfast at this hotel was one of the best that we had while in Italy. The major shortcoming of this hotel was its front desk and concierge staff. The front desk was not adequately staffed, and I found one of the chief concierges to be extremely rude and dismissive. Therefore, I cannot recommend this hotel. There are surely better hotels for the money in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: marmaduketravel
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is fantastic -- the location, the food, the rooms, the service. The price was high, but if you're looking to splurge, do it here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Old School Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Tommy0609
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed for 3 nights in a 1-bed suite. Overall, you get what you expect to get at a high-end Venetian hotel: classic decor, impeccable service, a bit of refurbishment needed here and there...all at a very high price. Venice in general is one of the most expensive places on earth, so a high-end hotel in Venice will naturally cost you dearly. Location/Ambience: Perfect. 5 minutes from San Marco. Across the canal from Guggenheim. Right next to most of the boutique shops in Venice. Also you get the classic "checking into a hotel in Venice" experience, which is you see the hotel as you slowly approach by boat, and step right off the boat into the hotel lobby. At some places (notably Danieli), I don't think you can do this. Il Palazzo is however adjoined to the larger and younger sister property Hotel Bauer (the two properties share elevators). The ambience is exactly what you would expect - wife squealed with delight when she saw the hotel for first time as we were approaching by boat, and you would half expect to see 007 sipping martini in a white tux in the hotel outdoor lounge area. The common area done with a classic Chinese motif. Room: Classic decor, actually so classic that it seems frozen in time (for example, the toilet seat was made of wood). Dim lighting, carpted floor, huge bed which you can melt into, and surprisingly spacious, especially the bathroom. Combination of age and constant presence of moisture result in a distinct smell, not just in our room but in all common areas as well. Not unbearable, but not too pleasant either. The main problem was the view - we had a good view of the alley below and the building next door, but no view of the canal. It was too late to do anything about it, but I would have paid extra for a canal view room. Food/Drinks: We ate out all the time, so cannot comment. But the hotel restaurant and lounge have one of the best views in the city. One thing to note that the famed B Bar at the hotel is undergoing renovation, so unavailable for a few months. Service: Friendly and formal. Restaurant recommendations spot on - all three dinners qualify as meals of a lifetime for us (they better be, since they cost about EUR350 each). Miscellaneous: This hotel is perfect for shopping. Everything within 2 minutes walk. Also a gondola station right next door, so very convenient if you simply must ride in one of those nasty eyesores. However if you are in town for the Venice Biennale (which we were), then hotel a bit out of the way (good 20-25 minute walk to the main exhibition halls). Conclusion is that we got exactly what we paid for and expected, and this hotel is definitely one of those "love it or hate it" places. If you are the type to take things in good humor, take pleasure in the fact that you're staying in a classic Venetian palazzo , and such pleasure outweighs everything else, then this place is perfect. If not, then try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, lovely hotel, got it almost perfectly right.”
Reviews.Author: Skatells
Reviews.Content: The Il Palazzo was a beautiful hotel in a great location. My fiance booked it for our honeymoon, and arriving by water taxi was a surprise I will never forget! The staff were attentive and the hotel was a quiet and peaceful haven in a perfect location. All of that said, the Il Palazzo had a few little, easy-to-make changes which would go a long way to improve the experience. First of all, there was little in the way of movies or english television viewing, which would be a nice addition. Also, the products provided in the beautiful bathrooms- though lovely- lacked conditioner; a minor point, but one of those things....Another small annoyance was that the hotel "offered" wi fi but charged guests to use it. For such a pricey and exclusive hotel some little free extras such as this would not go amiss. We also felt the food could use some work. The fine dining restaraunt was hugely expensive and, more to the point, completely forgettable. The courses were experimental to the detriment of taste and pleasure, though the wine list and service were commendable. The breakfast setting and service were truly lovely, but the choice could be expanded or changed (we stayed four nights and the breakfast lost a little charm with each subsequent partaking). We also used the spa facitilites at their sister hotel across the water (a free shuttle was offered). The spa staff didn't speak a word of English, but the treatments were excellent and the experience very relaxing and pleasant. All in all, I would say that the Il Palazzo was a truly, beautiful, decadent and lovely place to explore this beautiful city. With a couple of easy-to-make changes, they could be one of the best hoteld in the world, let alone Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: FriskyG
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice on the Orient Express and wondered how our hotel would top that. It certainly did! Our first suite (room 115) was on the Piano Nobile and very grand, with silk walls and huge Murano chandeliers, but it looked onto a brick wall. The next morning, as soon as I mentioned that "a view would be nice" we were shown two other suites and chose room 163. This room was less grand but it had beautiful views of the Dogana. The bathroom is exquisite (dark marble and Murano glass everywhere). An added delight was sitting on the canal-front verandah one afternoon when Prince Charles arrived. He and the Duchess of Cornwall were also staying there one night.

Reviews.Title: “I left a piece of my heart there”
Reviews.Author: jocar99
Reviews.Content: A Wonderful hotel in a fabulous location , 2 blocks from Piazza San Marco. Quiet and peaceful. Comfortable. A wonderful, friendly cheerful staff. Beyond our expectations! Great food! Beautiful inside and out. Water taxi brings you and your luggage to the front door , where the gondolas are waiting for you. Near shops and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect cobination of ancient spirit and modern comfort.”
Reviews.Author: Grabovezkaya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bauer when came to visit the Biennale Arcitecture exposition last year. And I never had to regret the choice! The hotel manages to keep and trasmit the genuine antique Vanetian atmosphere and to combine it with top-class modern levels of comfort and service! If you want to get a full immersion into the spirit of this wonderful city and to be sure that every your request would be satisfied by the hotel's staff, then this is defenitely a hotel for you! And yes, the "B bar" downsairs is one of places more "in" for having a drink in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Ermak
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Bauer for 4 nights including the New Years. The stay was a perfect Venetian vacation. The place has a sense of a genuine palazzo without being rusty. Location is hard to beat. Right on the Grand Canal with St Marco Sq only a couple of blocks away. The staff was very attentive and constantly delivered as expected and more. The room was clean and just right size to be very cozy, but luxurious at the same time. We asked for a room with the Grand Canal view and it was well worth it. Simply spectacular!!! Perhaps the only thing which they could improve is the brekfast menu, which was somewhat boring and with a limited selection. Otherwise, I would strongly recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “good, not great”
Reviews.Author: 4sunnyskies
Reviews.Content: We always stay in five star hotels and we expected the Bauer Il Palazzo to be one but were disappointed. I read through the other reviews and will agree that the location is fantastic and the 7th floor breakfast and view are amazing but the rooms and staff at the front desk need to be spruced up. Our room was nice but a bit plain and in need of new carpet. For the price we paid, we feel the room should have been in better shape as well as the corridors. I will also agree with some reviews that the hotel front desk was a bit snobby (not all but a couple) which definitely leaves a negative impression. We thought this would be the best hotel during our two week italy vacation but it was not and we don't think we will return to it.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and hotel”
Reviews.Author: waytogogirl
Reviews.Content: This is probably not the most grand in appearance hotel in Venice, but it is definately one of the very best in service and attention to detail. The lobby and public areas are very nice but not "knock you off your feet" showy by any means. The rooms are very elegant and in the traditional venetian style. The Bauer next door is much more contemporary for comparison. My favorite experience at the hotel was the breakfast on the top floor overlooking the grand canal. The breakfast was of the best quality and the view was amazing. The most impressive quality of the hotel was the service. Every need was anticipated by the staff and they followed through with every request. When waiting for the boat to come get us to take us to their sister property, they not only showed us outside to sit, but came for us when the boat arrived even though we could see the boat in view adjacent to us. At night the turn down service was royal style with slippers and a linen layed out on the floor on each side of the bed to step on so your feet never had to touch the floor ! The amenities in the room were luxury soaps, lotions and shampoos. I honestly have not stayed in a hotel any better in the way of service. To me, I would probably say service is the most important factor when you consider the rooms are always nice in a 5 star anyway, just vary in size and decor. So, this hotel def. owned up to it's 5 star status !! kudos go out to the entire staff !!

Reviews.Title: “fabbo”
Reviews.Author: nanrosemar
Reviews.Content: had a lovely stay hotel amazing although did ask for another room as was on side given suite, and had lovely 5 night stay. st marcs square 5 mins walk, and so pleased we had private water taxi back and forth to from airport. didnt eat at hotel although breakfast was super. staff were so helpful and will definately return

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Young-at-heart-99
Reviews.Content: The location of the Bauer is perfect for a trip to Venice. It has its own small square to the front of the hotel, it has tremendous views of the Grand Canal at the rear, and is only a 5 minute walk from St. Marks Square. We had a fantastic stay - the room was immaculate, and the staff couldn't have been more helpful from our check-in to when we left. The best recommendation for any hotel is "would you return? " - MOST DEFINITELY

Reviews.Title: “Magical Venice”
Reviews.Author: TRANSATLANTIC GUY
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very enjoyable, comfortable and everyone particularly Paolo the Head Concierge and the Bell Staff were very helpful to us. However, please note in order to visit Venice and stay in quality accomodation, given the strength of the â‚¬ against Â£ and $, you must expect it will be expensive. We booked a Panoramic Double Room with breakfast included: note that otherwise it would cost an additional â‚¬44 each. The room had a balcony overlooking a Gondola station and provided a view of the City and Grand Canal. It was too cold to sit outside but this would have been wonderful in warmer weather. The room was spacious, the bed comfortable and the marble bathroom with separate shower was beautiful. Breakfast was fine but we found the quality and service in the main restaurant on the ground floor better than the in the Il Palazzo facility which is adjacent to the roof terrance. However, in both locations the restaurant staff were eager to please. We were offered a water taxi service from Sante Lucia station with a hostess to the hotel but it was much more expensive than we paid separately through the Venice Welcome Service. The location is wonderful with a short walk to St Marks Square and all the shopping. The Concierge was delighted to explain the best way to see all the attractions and museums in the City and the surrounding islands such as Murano. Venice is expensive. The room rate was the highest we have paid at any hotel, but our stay was a wonderful almost magical experience. Incidentally wireless internet access for 4 days was â‚¬20 in total: good value for expensive European hotels. There were no surprises in the bill at check out. We would love to return to this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “all that glistens is not gold”
Reviews.Author: Rachypoos
Reviews.Content: There is no denying the fact the room was lovely. We had a drawing room with silk wallpaper and a jacuzzi bath for god's sake! The concierge were snobby and arrogant but the barmen, waitresses and maids were really nice. There are two bars at this hotel, the internal BB bar was twenty euros cheaper than the outside canal view bar for the same round of drinks, and when I queried this with the concierge, he just shrugged and said maybe we paid more for the view. Well, considering it was my birthday, and I had paid three hundred pounds for a room for one night, I was more than a little shocked by this reply. The staff seem to have a playground mentality and the older more important staff almost bullied the juniors and meek guests, no attempt was made to hide this. I liked the look and style of this hotel but compared to other 5 star hotels I have stayed with before, this was all "fur coat and no knickers".

Reviews.Title: “The best of Venice”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Bauer Il Palazzo and only have the highest praise for this wonderful, intimate hotel. Admittedly we were spoiled both times with amazing canal facing rooms. For this stay we had a junior suite on the top floor of the hotel overlooking the grand canal. Nearly every room is different so if you don't like the first room you are shown, kindly ask for another. The front desk staff are more than willing to do whatever they can to make your stay more enjoyable. I'm a bit of a hotel snob and have no reservations recommending this truly special Venetian hotel. Expensive? Yes (like everything else in Venice. But completely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing !”
Reviews.Author: Superix
Reviews.Content: Ten years ago, when I was a student, I stayed once at the Bauer, not the Palazzo Bauer, so I was expecting so much about this gorgious palazzo ... My husband booked the stay for my birthday. I was happy ! ... And then ! I got the same bedroom than I had ten years ago in the Bauer ! May be smaller ! Because, some suites are located in the palazzo but the regular or deluxe rooms are in the main building, the modern one. The service is really poor : 3 hours to get our luggage ... one of our coat lost ! No really overpriced and overestimated ! Don't go overthere ! It's just pretentious and expensive ! Prefer the Danieli or the Gritti !

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: Duettist96
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice on the Orient Express from London, and got a water taxi straight to the dock. I couldn't believe it - the doorman was waiting to welcome us with glasses of prosecco whilst our luggage was whisked up to our room. When we were ready we were shown to our room - which was lovely. No Grand Canal view - which was probably just as well, as the waterway is busy all the time! - but we could see the Campanile from the window. The entrance is small, and I can see that if you arrived on foot you might be confused by the rather bizarre way in which the two hotels are blended together but yet not blended - but once you sort out which is which, the Palazzo is simply exquisite. We ate in the De Psisis restaurant one night - not cheap, but wonderful food; we ate in the Fat Duck recently and there were one or two flavours in Venice which were that good. On the last day, we sat on the terrace with our feet almost dangling in the canal, and were able to request a light lunch. that was equally as perfect. The concierge was most helpful - and in no time at all we knew all the staff, and they knew us. This was a Silver Wedding trip for us, and everything, from the moment we stepped onto the train to the moment we left the hotel, was, frankly, perfect. And that, for once, includes the weather! With its situation, its staff and its all-out luxury appeal, I could not recommend it highly enough to anyone wanting something special. I want to go back - again and again and again......

Reviews.Title: “Bauer Il Pallazzo, I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: dora_pirate
Reviews.Content: Everything in Venice is expensive so put your qualms aside. This hotel is very nice and has the DISTINCT advantage of being in the middle of the most key section, yet being out of the way of the throngs that always seem to be moving through venice. There is something nice about fighting the crowds and then walking down the peaceful, almost secluded walk to the Bauer Il Pallazzo. Ladies, watch out, Prada is within arms length! Our rooms were spacious and wonderfully decorated, recently renovated, and lovely. The bathrooms were great and the service was excellent. The front desk got a bit crowded at times, but it was no worry. The rooftop breakfasts were great and the restaurant Da Pisis was crazy expensive but a GREAT place to lunch and look out over the grand canal. I will be staying at il Pallazzo next time I'm in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Palace ? by virtue of its prices only...”
Reviews.Author: ATNDubai
Reviews.Content: My wife just returned from our sixth visit to Venice and stayed at the San Clemente Palce (see review) and at the Bauer Palace. From the start, we were quite disapointed with the accomodation standards of the Bauer; our room was old, small, and looked like in need of a good refurbishment. No internet access our in room information available. Bathroom was fine (had been refurbished...), but small and had no separate shower. Breakfast was held on the Grand Canal, in a very pleasant setting. Choices were limited for a hotel of such claimed standards. Overall, we felt that we were staying in an old myth which had failed to evolve with the rest of the world. The only positive was the youngest concierge (sorry can't remember his name) who gave us some excellent recommendations and took good care of us. Conclusion: this place needs to wake up from its old faded glory and stop relying on its location only.

Reviews.Title: “Super elegant hotel in terrific location”
Reviews.Author: bretthodges
Reviews.Content: Our family just spent 3 nights at the Bauer Il Palazzo and found it to be an outstanding Venice hotel. The location is terrific - facing both the Grand Canal and a smaller canal that is a busy gondolier waiting location. It is quite near the piazza San Marco, and while this might sound like a drawback because of the large number of tourists there, in fact it's a plus - as this is also an area full of great shops and restaurants, and a busy vaporetto and water taxi stop. You wouldn't know about the crowds at all unless you walk that direction for 5 minutes. It's not cheap by any means and we stayed in a â€œpalatialâ€� room that had room for 3 people. Our room was high up (on the 6th floor) and looking over the Venetian rooftops and down on the canals was breathtaking. Breakfast is buffet style and excellent, and is served up on a balcony (and enclosed room) on the 7th floor overlooking the Grand Canal. The staff are friendly and animated (how can Italians have so much "joie de vivre"?).

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Tipster2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bauer Il Palazzo for 3 nights on May 17, 18 & 19, 2007. The hotel has a superb location on the Grand Canal, very close to St. Mark's, yet on a quiet side passage. I don't think there is a nicer place to stay in Venice if cost is not a concern. I had a palatial room with full canal view and a balcony. Very expensive, but worth it for a splurge. I spent a lot of time on the balcony watching the diverse activities on the Grand Canal. Traditional Venetian decor. Large marble bath with separate shower. The hotel is well maintained to a very high level. Outstanding concierge--not only knowledgeable, but regularly going above and beyond what is expected even of a hotel of this quality. And this is quality--a solid 5 stars. Only weakness was only one computer for guest use by both Il Palazzo and the adjoining Hotel Bauer, and the computer was inoperative for two days during my stay. Fortunately, I found an excellent internet spot on Campo Santo Stefano, an 8-minute walk, with a rate of 3 euros for each 20 minutes. The Il Palazzo is the higher end portion of the Bauer adjoining pair, with a site on the Grand Canal--the hotel is directly connected and also very nice, but has no Grand Canal frontage. Il Palazzo has an intimate atmosphere and, except for the internet shortcoming, was flawless. Breakfast is on the top (7th) floor and is a good buffet, but not outstanding. I did not eat dinner at the hotel, but had excellent dinners at Do Forni and at La Cusina in the nearby Hotel Europa & Regina. The latter restaurant has outside dining on the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: amigo42
Reviews.Content: Last April we spent a couple of days with friends in Venice. The hotel arranged our welcome at the airport and the boat ride to the hotel was very nice. Bauer Il Palazzo is a classic hotel, we got very nice rooms, and staff was very helpful. The location of the hotel is very convenient with the grande Canal in front of the hotel and the fancy shops (Prada, Chanel etc) just behind, and off course only a 100 meters of the San Marco Square. Best of our stay was the concierge who was very helpful in making our daily planning. Breakfast is at the rooftop, nice place, but selection could be little bigger. Lunch & Dinner at the terrace were very nice. The only thing we missed was a swimming pool, but after all it was a romantic city trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: jax2
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful trip to Venice, hotel is beautiful and staff are very attentive. The hotel could do with somewhere to sit and enjoy the sun . Paolo recommended a couple of nice restaurants for our evening meals. Amazing city! Gondola ride, although pretty expensive at 100 euros, was the highlight. Took a train ride to Lake Garda on the sunday, very nice! (Take good walking shoes.)

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robynlpa
Reviews.Content: When researching luxury hotels in Venice, I kept reading reviews of so-called 4 star or luxury hotels that did not live up to their rating, and also saw quite a few travelers' pictures of such hotels on this website that were scary. However, a couple friends had heard of Bauer Il Palazzo, and I didn't find anything too scary about it, so we went with it, despite the hefty price tag. The hotel did not disappoint. From our arrival, the staff was consistently friendly and helpful. We stayed in a deluxe double suite, which had a large king bed and walk-in closet, a nice sized sitting room (which we never used), a beautiful marble bathroom, and a spacious terrace with view of one of the side canals. My only disappointment with the room were the sheets--for such an expensive hotel, I would have expected luxuriously soft sheets, and these were not. Also, we had ants on the dresser in our room, but the staff immediately came and dealt with the problem when we notified them. The breakfast buffet, which was included with our stay, was pretty good, but the view from the rooftop terrace where you have breakfast was absolutely beautiful. You can reserve the rooftop jacuzzi with champagne and strawberries for one hour for a fee of 60 Euros. If you want to do this, book it in advance. It was completely booked both nights of our stay, but we were able to schedule an afternoon time, which ended up being perfect because it was about 80 degrees outside and sunny. The hotel also has a small but very nice exercise facility. I would definitely recommend the Il Palazzo.

Reviews.Title: “Got Engaged”
Reviews.Author: RobertCarlsbad
Reviews.Content: Prior to my going to Venice for my proposal, I carefully researched the different hotels including the Starwood properties, I ended up choosing the Bauer Il Palazzo. I could not have made a better choice. My stay was a wonderful experience. We had a balcony overlooking the canal which included their delicious breakfast buffet. In addition, the staff was exceptional and set us up with a very nice upgraded room. I would highly recommend this hotel and it will always have a special place in my heart. PS My proposal was accepted and we now have a beautiful baby girl.

Reviews.Title: “we can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: luctons
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay - we booked a junior suite at The Bauer to celebrate our tenth anniversary, but we were lucky enough to be upgraded to a delux suite at Il Palazzo. Suite 158 (with complimentray prosecco) was fantastic with a view of the side canal and the charming sounds of gondolas passing by our windows. Staff were all very friendly and helpful, service is very attentive - I don't think we ever opened a door of pushed the lift button! The opulent style of this historic part of the hotel was stunning and very comfortable. Breakfast on the seventh floor roof terrace is a delight, we lingered over it for an hour every day, and I have to confess to finishing it off - again every day - with some of their delicious cakes. It's a shame the terrace isn;t open throughout the day because the views are simply spectacular. And talking of spectacular views, don;t miss out on booking the rooftop jacuzzi. It's a once in a lifetime experience to sip prosecco and eat strawberries in a hot tub with the towers of St Marks in the background - very romantic and on second thoughts we should do it more than once! The location of the hotel is unbeatable - just minutes from St Marks and yet a quiet location that feels off the beaten track. We visited the bar at the Bauer for after dinner drinks and it was very nice, with good music and excellent service, but for me the atmosphere of Il Palazzo was the best. We had a great tour of Venice with the original venice Walk - our guide Sabrina was fantastic. It's also well worth visiting the getto for a tour of the old Jewish quarter and some amazing old synagogues - five of them! So to summarise Beautiful hotel superb location Excellent staff - every one of them Fantastic suite My only question is - how soon can I go back?

Reviews.Title: “Venetian style - comes at a price”
Reviews.Author: NBLondon
Reviews.Content: This romantic, small hotel is in an excellent position 2 minutes from St Mark's Square and offers olde worlde charm with all mod cons. Despite a great concierge and chambermaid room clean service, however, it doesn't quite manage to offer the highest levels of food or service which you'd expect at this price and a word of advice - make sure your booking is 100% clear about the room you'll be getting or you'll have to try to sort things out when you get there. In its favour is a personal approach to its guests, who front desk staff soon get to know by sight and name. But every extra comes at a price and although everything is done with charm and courtesy, the whole thing doesn't quite 'snap' as you'd expect.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: fivestarlady
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time typing this out yesterday in great detail but lost it, so I'll be brief this time! Absolutely amazing. The hotel was stunning, worth every penny (it was expensive, we stayed in a delux suite for 4 nights - 2,000 euro), the service was incredible from the concierges and waiting staff at the delicious breakfast. The taxi to and from the airport organised through the hotel was worth the 200 euro each way ridiculous price tag - James Bond style! We went all out because we probably won't return for a very long time and wanted it to be a very memorable trip. Our room was incredible - 1/2 bottle of champagne is a laughable 50 euro, but you have to forget about the prices here and just enjoy it - otherwise don't bother, as it will annoy you (as it did my boyfriend). Went to Harry's, again just so so expensive, but I enjoyed it. Go to Ristorante Masaniello in Campo S. Stefano, it was delicious and we both had a great time with Salvo the waiter - great fun! I will recommend the hotel to any of my friends, and equally the Bauer itself where we enjoyed many a glass of wine in the relaxing bar.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: cc17
Reviews.Content: I had to write after reading the last few reviews of Bauer Il Palazzo. I couldn't disagree with their experience more! I booked my room with American Express, and was given an upgrade to a beautiful room overlooking the canal. The room was very large, in great condition, and the bathroom and walk in closet were both huge! My only negative about the room was that the linens could be a bit softer/higher thread count... The room was a bit warm, but I simply shut off the heat using the in room thermostat. Problem solved. The shower was one of the best I've ever had in Europe - hard pressure! The breakfast is wonderful, and has one of the highest views of Venice. The restaurants recommended from the concierge were expensive, but honestly worth every penny. When we got to the restaurants, the owners treated us like royalty due to the concierge mention we were coming. The staff was beyond helpful, warm and inviting. I would stay there a million times based on the service and kindness of their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Bizarre - up and down”
Reviews.Author: SeagramLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a really bizarre hotel. When we arrived, we came in through the very grand entrance at the sister hotel â€“ The Bauer. Two lifts and a long walk later we had been led (by a very nice lady) to the not very grand entrance of Il Pallazzo. Our first room (653) was quite nice, but the view looked directly into five other rooms with less than two metres between us and the other room. Now, this room was hot. I mean temperature. It was mid winter, but the room was a good thirty degrees celcius. We immediately turned off all heat and opened the window and hoped that it would cool down. The next day we complained and were told that the head of maintenance would look into it. He did, but made no difference, so we got a second night of little sleep due to the fact that we were too warm. Just as the room finally cooled and we got off to sleep, we were awoken by a row in the next door room; the guy wanted to leave as he hated the hotel â€“ largely on account of it being too hot! I then wanted to leave because it was too hot and too loud! When we complained, we were given an amazing room overlooking San Marco. We have to ask why, in an empty hotel, staff would put guests into uninhabitable rooms when great rooms lay empty. I donâ€™t suspect the management of having great control. It was my wifeâ€™s birthday, so Iâ€™d booked a massage at the health â€˜spaâ€™ (aka treatment room) for her with concierge. Concierge had not bothered to actually tell the staff (who donâ€™t come in most days). The hot tub and steam room advertised on the web site are turned off to save energy. Forget the advertised reflexology (It doesn't exist), but the full massage was great. Concierge also managed to distinguish himself by telling us that the opera house was completely closed â€“ but did recommend an alternative. We went to the alternative, but next day saw that the opera house was open and an opera playing. Commission never came to mindâ€¦â€¦ And finally â€“ the restaurant. Avoid this like the plague. Again, this was booked weeks in advance, but they had no knowledge of our reservation. The food was amazingly bland and completely devoid of any kind of passion. I almost fell asleep during my first course and sent it back. The waiter merely smiled as if it happened all the time. The chef refused to come out and defend himself, but given his poor effort, I canâ€™t really blame him. The next day the manager did make the effort to come and talk to us. On the up side, the second room was great, the location is fantastic and the breakfast is fabulous. Most of the staff are very pleasant, but I just get the impression that they have lost the plot.

Reviews.Title: “I am totally unsure about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulhun
Reviews.Content: Having just returned home after a 3 night stay at the Bauer Il Palazzo, my husband and myself are rather confused. This hotel adjoins its sister hotel, The Bauer (rated 5 star), whilst the Il Palazzo is rated 5 star luxury. The only difference is that when you arrive at the hotel, depending on which one you are booked into, you either arrive at a private landing dock on the Grand Canal for the Il Palazzo, or you arrive in the San Moise canal for the Bauer. Of course there is a huge increase in the room rates for the Il Palazzo. For the cost of our rather unimpressive dingly room in the Il Palazzo, we could have had a superior suite in the Bauer!! The Bauer has a very grand and impressive foyer, whilst the supposedly grander Il Palazo has a very dark, and unimpressive entrance with worn wooden reception desk and nowhere for guests to sit whilst the check-in clerk talks on the telephone and leaves you standing there, wondering if you are in the right place. Once you have checked in, you are shown to your room by a rther more helpful receptionist, but the room (620) was not up to the standard of a 5 star luxury hotel. For reasons listed: 1. there were no complimentary slippers to go with the bath robe (however the Bauer guests do get the slippers and the robe)! 2. No complimentary fruit basket 3. No complimentary mineral water (this had to be purchased for *â‚¬8 from the minibar). 4. No complimentary newspapers. All restaurants (De Pisis and Canal Bar) were shared by both the Bauer and Il Palazzo. The breakfast rooftop room was also shared by both guests. In fact, there was absolutely no difference other than the over-inflated room rates for the Il Palazzo. So, back to our confusion, having checked the rooms on the hotel website for both hotels, we would undoubtedly not book for the Il Palazzo if we return to Venice. Why pay almost double room rates for absolutely nothing extra? We have stayed in many five star luxury hotels around the world, and we have to say that the Bauer Il Palazzo lacked those little extra luxuries that make the difference. The room was very small, drab in decor, the carpet needed a clean, and the staff seemed to use the room more than we did. One such chap just walked straight in (we were both in our robes), and he prompltly backed out again, rather embarrassed, but when my husband went after him to ask him what he wanted, he said "nothing"! So what was he coming into the room for? anyway, enough moaning, the stay in Venice, in early January, was magical, the hotel is perfectly situated (both hotels!) for all of the good shops, and sights. It really is only a 2 minute walk to San Marco Square. If you are thinking of staying at either of these hotels, I would recommend that you choose the Bauer, and not pay the inflated Il Palazzo prices because the extra cost is completely unjustifiable in my humble opinion. If anyone who has stayed here can explain what the difference is, please do share!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Livingoutofasuitcase
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location however it is 'attached' to the rather more standard Bauer Hotel. Ensure you want to pay more money for that 'historic feel' before booking here or alternatively the Bauer offers the same location. The rooms are small (welcome to Venice!) but nicely decorated. Bathrooms are superb. The 7th floor breakfast room and terrace are wonderful only pity is they stand empty without any use for the rest of the day. They really should use the space as a tearoom or bar in the evenings - stunning views. Hotel is lacking a lounge or bar! The restaurant is overarted I believe. Food is not bad but far too 'handled'. Good produce should mean less fuss. Venice is full of great places to eat as long as you make sure the conciege (great service!) points you in the right direction. Skip a visit to Murano unless you feel in the mood for being ripped off.

HotelInfo.Name: Bauer Il Palazzo
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 1413/d, 30124 Venice, Italy
